properties.title: Gravesend
properties.note: At this smal town on the english east coast near London Christian Ignatius Latrobe started his voyage to south africa. At the harbour he boarded the Albion, a brig that took him and several other missionaries on the journey to Cape Town.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 1
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/1/mode/2up

properties.title: Margate Roads
properties.note: This coastal town is called Margate today. Here the Albion found an anchoring place for an overnight stay.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 1
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/1/mode/2up

properties.title: South Foreland
properties.note: The southeastern headland near Dover was passed without any trouble “with a breeze at north-west” as Latrobe describes it.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 1
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/1/mode/2up

properties.title: between Dover and Calais
properties.note: Latrobe described perfect weather conditions while passing the Strait of Dover. In his journal he wrote that they could see the coasts of England and France as we passed between Dover and Calais.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 1
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/1/mode/2up

properties.title: Isle of Wight
properties.note: The ship passed the island on the south proceeding further through the English Channel.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 1
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/1/mode/2up

properties.title: 240 miles off the coast of Portugal
properties.note: The ship passes the coast of Portugal in a distance of 240 english miles (admiralty miles). Since there is no further description, the waypoint is an estimated coordinate, set to give an idea of the distance to the coast.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 5
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/4/mode/2up

properties.title: Porto Santo
properties.note: In his journal Latrobe describes concerns towards Certain rocks, marked in our charts as lying to the north of Porto Santo, and called the eight stones. The ship therefore probably passes the island in the north. However, the mentioned rocks are by now proven to be a myth. In addition, Latrobe described the difficulties of navigation and mentioned that the dead reckoning differed from chronometer by around 100 to 140 Miles (admiralty miles).
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 9
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/8/mode/2up

properties.title: Madeira
properties.note: As Latrobe describes, the ship passes the island far east, but still in visible distance.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 9
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/8/mode/2up

properties.title: Salvages
properties.note: The ship passed the islands which are by today refered to as Ilhas Selvagens in the northwest.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 11
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/10/mode/2up

properties.title: Piton rocks
properties.note: Latrobe referes to these rocks while describing the Ilhas Selvagens. It is possible that he referes to the isles of Selvagem Pequena and Fora Islet, but sources for these names are very rare and ought to be questioned critically.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 11
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/10/mode/2up

properties.title: Peak of Teneriffe, at about eighty miles distance
properties.note: The ship headed towards south, coming from the Ilhas Selvagens. Latrobe describes this point vaguely, not giving a second reference point. Therefore, the point set here is more of an estimation.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 12
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/12/mode/2up

properties.title: Teneriffe
properties.note: The ship passes the island of Tenerife probably in the northwest within a distance of approximately 80 Miles (admiralty miles).
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 12
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/12/mode/2up

properties.title: Palma
properties.note: The island of La Palma is described as in sight since October 25th, but in no specified direction. The ship passed it west of the island three days later and Latrobe described it as so close [...] that we could distinctly discern every object on shore.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 12
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/12/mode/2up

properties.title: Sal
properties.note: The island of Sal as part of the Cape Verde was approached, most likely from the north. An exact distance or direction however is not given.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 15
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/14/mode/2up

properties.title: Bonavista
properties.note: The island today known as Boa Vista or Ilha da Boa Vista was passed by the ship off its eastern coast. An exact distance or coordinates were not described.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 16
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/16/mode/2up

properties.title: Mayo
properties.note: The ship passes the isle of Maio without Latrobe being able to see the isle because of thick mist as he describes it.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 16
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/16/mode/2up

properties.title: Atlantic Ocean - Letter 1
properties.note: Latrobe has given these coordinates at the beginning of a letter dedicated to his eldest son Peter.
wasDerivedFrom: Letters to my Children; written at sea during a Voyage to the Cape of Good Hope, in 1815, Containing a Memorial of some occurrences in my past life. - Page 1
https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/15032921

properties.title: Atlantic Ocean - Letter 2
properties.note: Latrobe has given these coordinates at the beginning of a letter dedicated to his eldest daughter Charlotte.
wasDerivedFrom: Letters to my Children; written at sea during a Voyage to the Cape of Good Hope, in 1815, Containing a Memorial of some occurrences in my past life. - Page 13
https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/15032921

properties.title: Atlantic Ocean - Letter 3
properties.note: Latrobe has given these coordinates at the beginning of a letter dedicated to his second eldest daughter Agnes.
wasDerivedFrom: Letters to my Children; written at sea during a Voyage to the Cape of Good Hope, in 1815, Containing a Memorial of some occurrences in my past life. - Page 26
https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/15032921

properties.title: Atlantic Ocean - Letter 4
properties.note: Latrobe has given these coordinates at the beginning of a letter dedicated to his second eldest son John.
wasDerivedFrom: Letters to my Children; written at sea during a Voyage to the Cape of Good Hope, in 1815, Containing a Memorial of some occurrences in my past life. - Page 46
https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/15032921

properties.title: Atlantic Ocean - Letter 5
properties.note: Latrobe has given these coordinates at the beginning of a letter dedicated to his son Joseph.
wasDerivedFrom: Letters to my Children; written at sea during a Voyage to the Cape of Good Hope, in 1815, Containing a Memorial of some occurrences in my past life. - Page 66
https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/15032921

properties.title: Robben Island
properties.note: The ship approached the island coming from northwest into the Table Bay and passed it close by its west coast.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 31
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/30/mode/2up

properties.title: Capetown
properties.note: On Christmas Eve 1815 Latrobe's ship reached the city of Cape Town, in the Colony of South Africa.
wasDerivedFrom: Journal of a Visit to South Africa, in 1815, and 1816. with some Account of the missionary Settlements of the United Bretheren, near the Cape of Good Hope. - Page 31
https://archive.org/details/journalofvisitto00latr/page/30/mode/2up
